repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: Tamil version of the Vikramacarita, that is, 32 stories (Tamil katai) about the king Vikrama (Vikkiramātittaṉ) told to king Bhoja by the figurines (Tamil patumai) of his throne. By a Christian copyist (see Christian blessings U1, f[1]r, lm and U1 f94v4).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (December 2020).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

filiation.p: GOML R. 1972, R. 2244. UVSL, vol. 4, pp. 246-7, No. 2040. TMSSML, vol. 1 , 1925, Nos. 579 and 589.

collation.desc: 2 folios = front guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso.
94 folios = Vikkiramātittaṉ Patumaikkatai: Mūlam. Tamil foliation {1}-94.
3 folios = back guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso. Title (addition) on f[3]v.

supportDesc.condition: Fairly good state of preservation despite boreholes.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 422 (front cover, recto).
Shelfmark in black ink: N°13 (f[1]r). This shelfmark seems to correspond to ancien fonds 13, that is S.n. (1739), p. 434, no. XIII).

Left-marginal intertitles: f12v, f14v, f19v, f22r, f23v, f24r, f26v, f28v, f31r, f34v, f35v, f39v, f42r, f50v, f53r, f55r, f57v, f60r, f62r, f64r, f65v, f66v, f69r, f71v, f74v, f77r, f78v, f82r, f86r, f89r, f90v, f92r. See selection below.

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF. 400 x 30 mm.

origin.origDate: 1729 at the latest. Dated to 1775 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) and by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds. It appears that Vinson mixed-up information between BnF Indien 222 and BnF Indien 424 (same text, dated to Manmata year of the Jovian cycle, which could correspond to 1775).

provenance.p: Possibly copied in Pondicherry by Tamil Catholic converts.

acquisition.p: It appears to be the palm leaf Le meme [I.e. Vicramarquen Cadey] ecris sur du papier and Le meme livre [i.e. Vicramarken Kadey] ecris en papier sent by the Jesuits of the Mission du Carnate in 1729 for the library of the king of France and mentioned in ancien lists (BnF NAF 5442, f5r and f9r).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 49.
S.n. 1739. Catalogus codicum manuscriptorum Bibliothecae regiae. Tomus primus. Pars prima, complectens codices manuscriptos orientales. Paris: Typographia Regia. — See p. 434, no. XIII.
Zvelebil, Kamil Veith. 1997a. The Tamil Vikramaditya. JAOS 117.2: 294-305.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 97r, no. 391422.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, May 2022.
